discussion.content:
The Correct order is as follows:
1. Configure an export data project
2. Add the released products entity with a default refresh type set to incremental push only 
3. Configure the filter criteria for item group A
4. Create a recurring data job and configure the processing recurrence to start immediately.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/recurring-integrations
Answer must be wrong - entity should be added in the project prior to setting the filter and setting up batch execution.
Need link to documentation - answer looks wrong - configuring a param/filter AFTER the export begins?

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You are configuring a recurring integration in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. The released products entity is enabled for change tracking.

The integration must meet the following requirements:

‚Ä¢ Export released product information using the recurring integrations capability within the data management framework.
‚Ä¢ Export only released products assigned to item group A.
‚Ä¢ Export only the released product, which has been amended since the previous export.

You need to configure the recurring integration.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

A company uses finance and operations apps. The company operates and ships to only the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom. The company has online stores for each of the countries/regions.

The company requires its customers to purchase online merchandise from only the country/region where the customer is physically located and redirects the customer to the appropriate site.

You need to configure the requirements.

What should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Geo Detection appears to only exist in D365 Commerce, not F&O. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/commerce/geo-detection-redirection

comments.content: It says "Finance and operations apps" that should include commerce, finance, human resources and supply chain management.

questions.question_text:
A company implements Dynamics 365 Finance on-premises. The company uses Microsoft Office 2007.

The country/region address where a document originates must be included in the footer of documents. Users must be able to edit the address for a document by using Microsoft Word Online.

You need to implement Business Document Management (BDM).

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: Create a business process flow for each BDM template.
choices.D: Migrate the on-premises deployment to the cloud.
choices.A: Create a Power Automate cloud flow for each BDM template.

discussion.content:
Business Document Management (BDM) is a feature that lets business users edit business document templates by using Microsoft 365 service or the appropriate Microsoft Office desktop application.To use BDM, you need to meet the following requirements:
1. You must have Microsoft Office 2010 or later installed, or have a Microsoft 365 Office for the web subscription
2. You must have a cloud deployment of Dynamics 365 Finance
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/er-business-document-management

BDM seems not to be an option in on-premises environments:
"Currently, the Business document management feature is implemented only for cloud deployments. If this feature is critical to your on-premises deployment, let us know by providing feedback on the Ideas site".
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/er-business-document-management

comments.content: NVM lol your right! CD. "Users must be able to edit the address for a document by using Microsoft Word Online."

WAIT! I think its AC now, read doc again. 
To use Business document management for editing templates in Excel or Word formats by using Microsoft Office desktop applications, you must have Microsoft Office 2010 or later installed.***This is supported in cloud and on-premises deployments***

To use Business document management for editing templates in Excel or Word formats by using Microsoft 365 applications, you must have Microsoft 365 Office for the web subscription. This is supported in cloud deployment."

discussion.content:
should the answer be CD, based on the description below?

To use Business document management for editing templates in Excel or Word formats by using Microsoft 365 applications, you must have Microsoft 365 Office for the web subscription. This is supported in cloud deployment.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/er-business-document-management

Customer records = Data entity
New purchase order = Composite data entity
Open sales order = Composite data entity
Bank Statement = Data entity 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/guidance/resources/import-products

‚Ä¢ customer records with a primary phone number and home address sourced from a comma-separated value (CSV) file: This must use "Entity"
‚Ä¢ new purchase orders using a synchronous integration from a third-party system: This must use "Entity" since composite entity does not support synchronous integrations (only asynchronous)
‚Ä¢ open sales order header and line details sourced in XML format: This must use "Composite entity" since it is the only one that supports XML
‚Ä¢ bank statement history sourced from multiple Microsoft Excel files: This must use "Entity"since composite entity supports only XML format

C
C
D
As it is a join table thing
Wrong. Open Sales Orders is the only one coming from XML and thus the only one that can be Composite.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You are implementing Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

You must import the following data into the system:

‚Ä¢ customer records with a primary phone number and home address sourced from a comma-separated value (CSV) file
‚Ä¢ new purchase orders using a synchronous integration from a third-party system
‚Ä¢ open sales order header and line details sourced in XML format
‚Ä¢ bank statement history sourced from multiple Microsoft Excel files

You must use the least number of data entities possible. You must not manipulate the source data.

You need to identify which data entity type to use for each data import.

Which data entity types should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate data entity types to the correct data sources. Each data entity type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

You assign security roles to users in a company.

New purchasing managers must be able to have a single role assigned to them to accomplish all tasks. The purchasing manager role has the following requirements:

‚Ä¢ Must be standalone and not impacted when another security role is changed.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to view payment journals but not edit them.

The purchasing manager role does not currently have access to the payment journals.

You need to edit the security configuration to meet the requirements.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A privilege is a collection of permissions that are required to perform a task
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/sysadmin/role-based-security

choices.B: Assign an existing security role with read-only access to the payment journal as a sub role.
choices.A: Create an Extensible Data Security (XDS) policy and add the payment journal table as a constrained table.
choices.D: Create a new security role for the payment journal access.
choices.C: Create a privilege for the read-only access for the payment journal tables.
